text: Shop drawings and structural design reviewed and approved
Anchor bolt plans issued and coordinated with foundation design
Certified engineered drawings (stamped) submitted and match building permit set
Delivery checklist confirmed: main frames, girts, purlins, panels, accessories, fasteners

id: B. Foundation and Anchor Bolt Prep

text: Anchor bolts installed per layout, elevations, and embedment requirements
Bolt threads clean, protected, and plumb prior to structural steel arrival
Concrete flatness, level, and hold-down locations verified
Structural steel members inspected for damage, twist, corrosion
Frames erected plumb and braced per sequence in erection manual
Bolts torqued and documented per manufacturer's tensioning specs
Temporary bracing in place during all phases of erection until diaphragm secured

id: D. Roof and Wall Panel Installation

text: Insulation, vapor barrier, and liner panels (if used) installed as per system
Panels installed straight, with correct lap orientation and spacing
Fasteners spaced per drawing and properly seated (not overdriven/underdriven)
Flashing, trim, sealant, and closures installed without gaps or buckling
Downspouts, gutters, ridge vents, and louvers installed complete
Punch list items (panel scratches, open seams, missing hardware) corrected
Warranty documents, erection certificate, and O&M manuals submitted
Structural engineer and manufacturer signoff received (if required)

id: • CSA A660, NBC, MBMA Manual, CAN/CSA S16, AISC, ASTM A325/A490
• Manufacturer Specs: Butler, Varco Pruden, Star, Robertson, Metallic, Nucor, Behlen
